title: USDA Steps In To Relieve Salmon Glut
teaser: With an overabundance of pink salmon, the USDA is buying cans of salmon to help keep prices up and give to food banks.
contentencoded:
There’s an overabundance of pink salmon this year.

In response, the USDA is buying up almost $40 million worth of canned salmon. The move helps fisherman keep prices up, and the salmon get donated to food banks.

From the Here & Now Contributing Station, KUOW‘s Carolyn Adolph reports the government decision to purchase the salmon is a relief to both fishermen and distributors.

  • KUOW: Feds Snap Up Pink Salmon(Fishermen Say Phew!)

Reporter

  • Carolyn Adolph, economy reporter at KUOW. She tweets @carolynadolph
